question:
The following spectroscopic data ($^{13}C$ NMR and $IR$) are for several isomeric amines of the formula $\ce{C_6H_{15}N}$. Propose a structure for each compound. 

**(a)** $^{13}C$ NMR: $\delta = 23.7$ $\ce{(CH_3)}$ and 45.3 ($\ce{(CH)}$) ppm. IR: 3300 $cm^{-1}$. 

**(b)** $^{13}C$ NMR: $\delta$ = 12.6 ($\ce{(CH_3)}$ ) and 46.9 ($\ce{(CH_2)}$ ) ppm. $IR$: no bands in 3250–3500  $cm^{-1}$ range. 

**(c)** $^{13}C$ NMR: $\delta$ = 12.0 ($\ce{(CH_3)}$ ), 23.9 (CH2), and 52.3 (CH2) ppm. $IR$: 3280 $cm^{-1}$. 

**(d)** $^{13}C$  NMR: $\delta$ =14.2 ($\ce{(CH_3)}$), 23.2 ($\ce{(CH_2)}$), 27.1 ($\ce{(CH_2)}$), 32.3 ($\ce{(CH_2)}$), 34.6 ($\ce{(CH_2)}$), and 42.7 ($\ce{(CH_2)}$) ppm. $IR$: 1600 (broad), 3280, and 3365 $cm^{-1}$. 

**(e)** $^{13}C$ NMR: $\delta$ = 25.6 (CH3), 38.7 ($\ce{(CH_3)}$), and 53.2 ($C_{quaternary}$) ppm. $IR$: no bands in 3250–3500 $cm^{-1}$ region.
